tutorial.title: Yield to Maturity of a Bond
tutorial.scenario:
You are looking to purchase a 3-year, $1,000 par, 10% annual coupon bond. Payments begin one year from now. The price of the bond is $1,074.51 per $1,000 par value. What is the yield to maturity of the bond?

Play
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries.
Enter the number of periods (in this case 3), and then press the N button.
Enter the dollar coupon payment per period (in this case 100), and then press the PMT button.
Enter the par value of the bond that you would receive at maturity in year 3 (in this case 1000), and then press the FV button.
Enter the present value or price of the bond (in this case 1074.51), and then press the +/- button followed by the PV button.
Press the CPT button and then the I/Y button to solve for the yield to maturity of the bond.
